title: TikTok Strikes Deal to Create New U.S. Entity and Loosen App’s Ties to China
summary: The Chinese parent company of the popular video app said a group of non-Chinese investors would create an American TikTok to avoid a federal ban.

title: Here’s Who Just Bought TikTok
summary: Several big companies and investment firms are part of the new American TikTok. Many have ties to one another and President Trump.

title: Will I Have to Download a New TikTok App? And Other Big Questions About The Deal.
summary: The popular short form video app has a new corporate structure in the United States, which could result in some changes for the 200 million Americans who use TikTok.

title: Jack Smith Testifies in House Hearing About Trump Investigations
summary: The former special prosecutor argued a case he was never allowed to in court: that President Trump “engaged in criminal activity” that undermined democracy.

title: Takeaways From Jack Smith’s Testimony on Trump Investigations
summary: In his remarks, the former special counsel repeatedly denied that he had acted out of partisan animus and bemoaned the Trump administration’s efforts to go after the president’s perceived enemies.

title: D.H.S. Cited Foreign Students’ Writings and Protests Before Their Arrests
summary: Documents unsealed by a federal judge on Thursday include dossiers that investigators prepared on pro-Palestinian student activists before they were targeted for deportation.

title: Immigration Agents Detain 5-Year-Old Boy in Minnesota, Prompting Outrage
summary: A photo showed a boy with an oversized hat and Spider-Man backpack being held next to a vehicle as his father was detained. A Homeland Security spokeswoman said the man had fled and left the child.

title: Chicago Jury Acquits Immigrant Accused in Bovino Murder-for-Hire Trial
summary: Prosecutors said a Chicago carpenter had offered a bounty for killing Gregory Bovino, a Border Patrol official. Defense lawyers said he was just sharing a social media post.

title: White House Posts Altered Photo Showing Arrested Minnesota Protester Crying
summary: The New York Times ran the image posted by Kristi Noem, the homeland security secretary, as well as the one posted by the White House through an A.I. detection system. It concluded that the White House’s version showed signs of manipulation.

title: Trump Rescinds Canada’s Invitation to Join His ‘Board of Peace’
summary: The president appeared to be lashing out in response to stark, high-profile remarks by Prime Minister Mark Carney of Canada that rejected Mr. Trump’s efforts to dismantle the international order.

title: Nazis, Soviets and Trump: America’s Fixation With Greenland
summary: The idea that Greenland is essential to the United States has returned with a vengeance in the Trump era.

title: Why Trump’s Reversal on Greenland Still Leaves Europe on Edge
summary: Andrew Ross Sorkin, editor at large of DealBook, describes how leaders at the World Economic Forum in Davos remain on edge after President Trump, for now, backed down from threats of using tariffs or military force to gain Greenland.

title: Mark Carney Says Firmly That ‘Canada Doesn’t Live Because of the United States’
summary: The Canadian prime minister spoke after returning from the World Economic Forum where he urged middle powers to team up in resisting President Trump.

title: Zelensky Laces Into Europe, Saying It Must Step Up or Be Left Behind
summary: The Ukrainian leader’s speech in Davos, Switzerland, was one of his most scathing critiques of his closest allies.

title: Are You Aging Well? 4 Simple Tests to Find Out.
summary: They can’t guarantee future health, but they can tell you the trajectory you’re on.

title: House Passes Spending Package Over Democratic Revolt on ICE
summary: Approval of the package, which would fund a wide swath of government agencies, brings Congress closer to meeting a Jan. 30 funding deadline.

title: National Park Service Dismantles Slavery Exhibit in Philadelphia
summary: The exhibit memorialized nine people enslaved by George Washington. The Park Service said it was being removed in accordance with a directive from President Trump.

title: Trump to Expand ‘Mexico City’ Abortion Rule to Include D.E.I. and Gender
summary: The policy has traditionally been aimed at keeping organizations that receive U.S. tax dollars from performing or promoting abortion as a method of family planning.

title: E.P.A. Revives Plan to End Testing on Animals by 2035
summary: Lee Zeldin, the E.P.A. administrator, revived a plan created during the first Trump administration to end the testing of chemicals on mammals.

title: U.S. Winter Storm Forecast to Bring Menacing Mix of Snow, Ice and Cold
summary: Half the U.S. population will likely see some effect from the sprawling storm that will move across the country this weekend, meteorologists said.

title: New York Could See Its Biggest Snowfall in Years
summary: The National Weather Service warned of “considerable disruption to transportation and daily life” from Sunday into Monday.

title: How a Major Winter Storm This Weekend Could Affect Your Travel Plans
summary: Ice, sleet and possibly significant snowfall are threatening to snarl travel in much of the eastern U.S. starting on Friday. Here’s what to know.

title: Why iPhone and Android Weather Apps Are Freaking Out About Winter Storm Forecasts
summary: A foot of snow in New York? Two feet? Well, it’s complicated.

title: Five Fronts in Trump’s Culture War
summary: In the first year of his second term, President Trump has made sweeping efforts to influence the arts and media in America.

title: Nurses in New York City Say They Deserve $200,000 a Year. Here’s Why.
summary: As a strike by health workers stretches into its second week, pay is a major issue in negotiations, even if it’s not discussed much on the picket line.

title: Big Insurers Try to Shift Blame for High Health Costs to Hospitals and Drug Makers
summary: At two congressional hearings, lawmakers slammed executives of major companies, saying they were failing to rein in the cost of medical care for consumers.

title: No Beer for You: How British Pubs Fought a Tax Increase
summary: More than 1,400 pubs declared a ban on Labour lawmakers in response to a plan to raise business rates significantly. The move got attention, and results.

title: Questions for Alex Honnold Before He Tries to Climb a Skyscraper in Taipei
summary: Alex Honnold again will be ascending without ropes. In an interview he considers the impact on his family if something were to go wrong.

title: Oscar Snubs and Surprises: ‘Sinners’ Makes History, ‘Wicked’ Withers
summary: Ariana Grande, Chase Infiniti and Paul Mescal were shut out, but voters made room for Delroy Lindo, Kate Hudson and “F1.”

title: 2026 Oscar Nominations: See the Full List
summary: The movies competing for the 98th Academy Awards. The ceremony will air on March 15.

title: NATO as We Know It Is Coming to an End, and That’s OK
summary: Europe has a chance to step out of America’s shadow.

title: Latin Americans Love the Right. Can You Blame Them?
summary: The right is ascendant in Latin America. How long will it last?

title: F.A.A. Says Helicopter Restrictions Imposed After D.C. Crash Will Stay
summary: The agency said that expanding the restrictions and making them permanent were urgent steps for avoiding another crash.

title: Dallas County Exonerates Black Man Who Was Executed in 1956
summary: An all-white jury convicted Tommy Lee Walker of rape and murder, relying on inadmissible evidence and a coerced confession that he immediately recanted, county officials said.

title: Barron Trump Called U.K. Police After Witnessing Woman ‘Getting Beat Up’ on Video Call
summary: The details of an emergency call made by President Trump’s youngest son to the London police last year emerged during a trial this week.

title: James Bernard, a Founding Editor of a Hip-Hop ‘Bible,’ Dies at 58
summary: One of the most influential voices of the seminal magazine The Source, he chronicled rap’s rise and its explosion into the cultural mainstream.
